children.value: The rule applies to any HTML
, or any HTML element with the
attribute. Difference in letter casing, and forward and trailing
that serves an equivalent purpose to the
There are no major accessibility support issues known for this rule.
F30: Failure of Success Criterion 1.1.1 and 1.2.1 due to using text alternatives that are not alternatives (e.g., filenames or placeholder text)
uses the filename which accurately describes the image.
<img src="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/img/w3c" alt="w3c" />
includes the filename, which in combination with the text content of the

<a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/img/w3c.png" download
	>Download <img src="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/img/w3c.png" alt="w3c.png"
/></a>
matches the image filename. However the presence of the file extension in the
is redundant and results in the
<img src="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/img/w3c.png" alt="w3c.png" />
that matches the filename. However the presence of the file extension in the
is redundant and results in the
<input type="image" src="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/before/img/top_weather.gif" alt="top_weather.gif" />
element doesn't have the semantic role of image.
<img role="presentation" alt="" />
<img style="display:none;" alt="" />
is not equivalent to the file name specified in the
<img src="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/after/img/teaser_right2.jpg" alt="modanna lily" />
attribute matches the filename but is overridden by the
value which takes precedence in the

<img
	src="https://www.w3.org/WAI/demos/bad/after/img/teaser_right2.jpg"
	alt="teaser_right2.jpg"
	aria-label="modanna lily"
/>
